p: Long low-wind periods are crucially difficult for the operation of future renewable power systems [ 13]. An increasing magnitude for such extreme events thus represents a serious challenge for renewable integration. In Eastern Europe, Italy, Greece and Norway relative changes are weaker and not robust. The effect develops mostly in the second half of the century (cf. Fig B in S2 Appendix) and for strong climate change (RCP8.5, cf. Fig B in S3 Appendix).
